alert.note: Alert for Beckham; Blaine; Custer; Roger Mills; Washita (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 01 at 8:48PM CDT until June 02 at 12:00AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: The National Weather Service in Norman has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... Southwestern Blaine County in northwestern Oklahoma... Northeastern Beckham County in western Oklahoma... Custer County in western Oklahoma... Southeastern Roger Mills County in western Oklahoma... Northwestern Washita County in western Oklahoma... * Until midnight CDT. * At 848 PM CDT, Continued heavy rain continues across much of southern Custer county, along and just north of Interstate-40. Flooding of area roadways has been reported and flooding will likely get worse through the evening. Between 4 and 8 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 2 to 4 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Emergency management reported. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Elk City, Weatherford, Clinton, Thomas, Arapaho, Hammon, Custer City, Butler, Foss, Strong City, Foss Reservoir, Moorewood and Stafford. This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between mile markers 52 and 86. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.

area.areaDesc: Beckham; Blaine; Custer; Roger Mills; Washita
